comment._content: Ōkuma Shigenobu see also

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content:
From this portion of the Des Jardien Wikpedia article, it's apparent that this photo dates from the Fall of 1915:
"Instead of playing Major League Baseball in the summer of 1915, Des Jardien traveled to Asia with the University of Chicago baseball team. ... On September 24, 1915, the Chicago team played a double header in front of a crowd of 20,000 people in Tokyo. Des Jardien pitched both games, defeating Waseda 5-3 and the Keio University 4-1. Des Jardien hit a home run and struck out 11 batters in the game against the Keio.[19]
Des Jardien served as an assistant coach for the University of Chicago's basketball, baseball and track teams upon returning from Japan in January 1916.[20][21]"

According to Ōkuma's Wikipedia entry, he founded Waseda University in Tokyo.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59: Thanks for pointing us to additional information on the two pictured here.
